  • These 1Blocker packages by @jthingelstad have made the Internet so much nicer to use for me. They block all requests aimed at domains controlled by Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Reddit, and more. Fantastic.

     01 December 2017

     29 November 2017

  • An Australian electrician discovered that he could keep his employer from creepily tracking his location by putting his mobile device in a mylar snack bag, using the bag as a Faraday cage to block GPS signals. Congratulations to you, sir.

     29 November 2017

  • I dreamed about an app that lets users take 360-degree photography of their homes, and then post it publicly for all to see; it also encouraged publication of one’s home address and phone number. It led to a horrific spate of home invasions, harassment, and other crimes. People loved it.

     29 November 2017

  • The edge of the world.

     28 November 2017

  • Correction: Brian Krebs points out that the High Sierra root bug is exploitable remotely if the attacked machine has Screen Sharing enabled. Probably a good idea to change the root password on all Macs ASAP.

     28 November 2017

  • The MacOs High Sierra root account bug is indeed serious, and it is indeed due to a really amazingly dumb failure in Apple’s QC checks. Bear in mind that the threat model entails physical access to the machine, and that there is a workaround in enabling a root account and giving it a decent password. For many users, there may not be much to worry about, and Apple will certainly issue a fix soon. Still, this is a really dumb bug.

     28 November 2017

  • Another day, another revelation of disgusting behavior taking place at Uber.

     28 November 2017

  • “Someone” submitted a million fake comments to the FCC which appear to favor their push to upend Net Neutrality. They may even have posted such a comment under your name. Comcastroturf will help you search the FCC’s site for comments fraudulently posted on your behalf.

     28 November 2017

  • Imgur was breached in 2014. That’s three freaking years ago.

     27 November 2017

  • I am experimenting with the idea of avoiding all news six days out of the week, and then just diving deeply into it on the seventh day. This way I only get kicked in the guts once per week.

     27 November 2017
